name: strawberry production, in unheated greenhouse | strawberry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15469/documentation

This global dataset is a copy of the regional CH dataset, except for the following modifications.;The production volume represents the global annual production.;The geographicalCorrelation score of every pedigree matrix of was changed to '5'.;Yield of the global dataset = 60000 kg/ha, calculated as a weighted average of the regional yields.;The comments below were part of the CH regional dataset.;This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of strawberry. The reference flow is the average yield per ha.yr and year, from 2009 - 2012: yield (60t/ha.y) obtained under irrigated conditions (total amount of water 493 m3/ha.y). The data are representative for strawberry production in Switzerland under non-heated greenhouse conditions. Typically, greenhouses are heated from March to May as to enable a first early harvest. Greenhouses are then non-heated from May to October which results in two additional harvests. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 288-108-384 kg/ha. No organic fertilisers are applied. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 27.5 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 2.0 (i.e. very good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends with harvest and transport to the farm gate. Storage is not included. 
The dataset includes all activities during a cycle, i.e. all machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations include: soil cultivation, fertilisation, pesticide application, harvesting, and on-farm transport. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. Irrigation is included, as well as greenhouses infrastructures and energy consumption when relevant. The inputs of seedlings, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0125:Growing of other tree and bush fruits and nuts

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The amount of the exchanges are copy from a regional dataset.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports. Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country; L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L1; Machinery: L0; Irrigation: L2. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf

Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonia, liquid', 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.60E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
